question: Dinitrogen and dioxygen, the main constituents of air do not react with each other in atmosphere to form oxides of nitrogen because (July 2022)
question_latex: Dinitrogen and dioxygen, the main constituents of air do not react with each other in atmosphere to form oxides of nitrogen because (July 2022)
options: A. oxides of nitrogen are unstable.
B. reaction between them can occur in the presence of a catalyst.
C. $N_{2}$ is unreactive in the condition of atmosphere.
D. the reaction is endothermic and require very high temperature.
solution: Dinitrogen and dioxygen are the main constituents of air but these do not react with each other to form oxides of nitrogen because the reaction is endothermic and requires very high temperature. [cite: 16]

question: Which of the following is/are paramagnetic? $NO_{2}$, NO, $N_{2}O_{4}$, $N_{2}O_{2}$, $N_{2}O_{5}$
question_latex: Which of the following is/are paramagnetic? $NO_{2}$, NO, $N_{2}O_{4}$, $N_{2}O_{2}$, $N_{2}O_{5}$
solution: NO and $NO_{2}$ have unpaired electrons, thus paramagnetic. [cite: 18]

question: Select the correct statements for diborane: (i) Boron is approximately hybridized (ii) B-H-B angle is $180^{\circ}$ (iii) There are two terminal B - H bonds for each boron atom (iv) There are only 12 bonding electrons
question_latex: Select the correct statements for diborane: (i) Boron is approximately $sp^{3}$ hybridized (ii) B-H-B angle is $180^{\circ}$ (iii) There are two terminal B - H bonds for each boron atom (iv) There are only 12 bonding electrons
solution: Boron in diborane is $sp^{3}$ hybridized. [cite: 29] There are two terminal B-H bonds for each boron atom. [cite: 20] Only 12 bonding electrons are available. [cite: 30] The B-H-B angle is $97^{\circ}$, not $180^{\circ}$. [cite: 31]

question: What is the colour obtained when borax is heated in a Bunsen burner flame with CoO?
question_latex: What is the colour obtained when borax is heated in a Bunsen burner flame with CoO?
solution: When borax is heated in a Bunsen burner flame with CoO on a loop of platinum wire a blue coloured $Co(BO_{2})_{2}$ bead is formed. [cite: 35]

question: The structure of diborane $(B_{2}H_{6})$ contains (2005)
question_latex: The structure of diborane $(B_{2}H_{6})$ contains (2005)
options: A. four $2c-2e$ bonds and two $3c-2e$ bonds
B. four $2c-2e$ bonds and four $3c-2e$ bonds.
C. two $2c-2e$ bonds and two $3c-3e$ bonds
D. two $2c-2e$ bonds and four $3c-2e$ bonds
solution: The structure of diborane $(B_{2}H_{6})$ contains four $2c-2e$ bonds and two $3c-2e$ bonds. [cite: 40]

question: Which element reacts with chlorine to give pentachloride?
question_latex: Which element reacts with chlorine to give pentachloride?
solution: All these elements (P, As, Sb) show +5 covalency and can form pentachlorides. [cite: 57]

question: All of the following are bases except
question_latex: All of the following are bases except
solution: $N_{3}H$ (Hydrazoic acid) is acidic in nature, while the others are basic. [cite: 59, 60]

question: White phosphorus reacts with thionyl chloride to give (July 2022)
question_latex: White phosphorus reacts with thionyl chloride to give (July 2022)
solution: White phosphorus $(P_{4})$ reacts with thionyl chloride $(SOCl_{2})$ as follows: $P_{4}+8SOCl_{2}\rightarrow 4PCl_{3}+4SO_{2}+2S_{2}Cl_{2}$. [cite: 64]

question: Assertion: Nitrogen and oxygen are the main components in the atmosphere but these do not react to form oxides of nitrogen. Reason: The reaction between nitrogen and oxygen requires high temperature. (2015)
question_latex: Assertion: Nitrogen and oxygen are the main components in the atmosphere but these do not react to form oxides of nitrogen. Reason: The reaction between nitrogen and oxygen requires high temperature. (2015)
options: A. The assertion is incorrect, but the reason is correct.
B. Both assertion and reason are correct, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.
C. Both assertion and reason are correct and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion.
D. Both the assertion and reason are incorrect.
solution: Dinitrogen and dioxygen combine to form nitric oxide only when the mixture is heated to very high temperatures (2273-3273 K) in an electric arc. [cite: 73]

question: The number of carbon atoms in Buckminsterfullerene is
question_latex: The number of carbon atoms in Buckminsterfullerene is
solution: Buckminsterfullerene has the formula $C_{60}$ and is made from interlocking hexagonal and pentagonal rings of carbon atoms. [cite: 76]

question: Among these ores the highest phosphorus content is in
question_latex: Among these ores the highest phosphorus content is in
solution: Phosphorite has the highest phosphorus content among the listed options. [cite: 78]

question: There is no S-S bond in
question_latex: There is no S-S bond in
solution: In $S_{2}O_{7}^{2-}$, the structure is $O_{3}S-O-SO_{3}$ which contains an S-O-S bond but no S-S bond. [cite: 95]

question: $BF_{3}$ behaves as a
question_latex: $BF_{3}$ behaves as a
options: A. Lewis acid and lone pair from the Lewis base is filled into empty $2p_{z}$ orbital
B. Lewis base and lone pair on B is donated to empty orbital of the Lewis acid
C. Amphoteric species due to interaction with acid and base both
solution: $BF_{3}$ is an electron-deficient molecule and acts as a Lewis acid by accepting a lone pair into its empty $2p_{z}$ orbital. [cite: 99, 100]

question: Consider the following statements for diborane 1. Boron is approximately $sp^{3}$ hybridized 2. B-H-B angle is $180^{\circ}$ 3. There are two terminal B - H bonds for each boron atom 4. There are only 12 bonding electron available Of these statements
question_latex: Consider the following statements for diborane 1. Boron is approximately $sp^{3}$ hybridized 2. B-H-B angle is $180^{\circ}$ 3. There are two terminal B - H bonds for each boron atom 4. There are only 12 bonding electron available Of these statements
solution: Statements 1, 3, and 4 are correct. The B-H-B angle is $97^{\circ}$, not $180^{\circ}$. [cite: 29, 30, 31, 104]

question: The number of hydrogen atom(s) attached directly to phosphorus in $H_{3}PO_{2}$ is
question_latex: The number of hydrogen atom(s) attached directly to phosphorus in $H_{3}PO_{2}$ is
solution: In hypophosphorous acid $(H_{3}PO_{2})$, there are two P-H bonds. [cite: 107, 108, 109]

question: Match List - I (Industrial process) with List - II (Application).
question_latex: Match List - I (Industrial process) with List - II (Application).
solution: Haber's process is for $NH_{3}$ synthesis. Ostwald's process is for $HNO_{3}$ synthesis. Contact process is for $H_{2}SO_{4}$ synthesis. Hall-Heroult process is for Aluminium extraction. [cite: 121]

question: Soda free glass fibre are made of
question_latex: Soda free glass fibre are made of
solution: Soda-free glass fibers are composed of $H_{3}BO_{3}$, $B_{2}O_{3}$, and $Ca_{3}(BO_{3})_{2}$. [cite: 124]

question: Concentrated nitric acid, upon long standing turns yellow-brown due to the formation of
question_latex: Concentrated nitric acid, upon long standing turns yellow-brown due to the formation of
solution: Nitric acid decomposes over time to form $NO_{2}$ (nitrogen dioxide), which is a brown gas: $4HNO_{3} \rightarrow 2H_{2}O + 2NO_{2} + 3O_{2}$. [cite: 129]

question: Which of the following has the regular tetrahedral structure?
question_latex: Which of the following has the regular tetrahedral structure?
solution: $BF_{4}^{-}$ has $sp^{3}$ hybridization and no lone pairs, resulting in a regular tetrahedral structure. $SF_{4}$ is see-saw, $XeF_{4}$ is square planar, and $[Ni(CN)_{4}]^{2-}$ is square planar. [cite: 133, 134, 135, 136]

question: The oxide which is solid at room temperature is:
question_latex: The oxide which is solid at room temperature is:
solution: $N_{2}O_{5}$ is a white crystalline solid at room temperature and melts at $30^{\circ}C$. [cite: 140]

question: The factor responsible for weak acidic nature of B-F bonds in $BF_{3}$ is
question_latex: The factor responsible for weak acidic nature of B-F bonds in $BF_{3}$ is
options: B. three centred two electron bonds in $BF_{3}$
solution: The weak Lewis acidic nature is due to $p\pi - p\pi$ back bonding between the filled 2p orbital of F and the empty 2p orbital of B. [cite: 144, 145, 148]

question: How many six membered and five membered rings are present in fullerene?
question_latex: How many six membered and five membered rings are present in fullerene?
solution: Fullerene $(C_{60})$ contains twenty 6-membered rings and twelve 5-membered rings. [cite: 152]

question: The incorrect statement is (Aug 2021)
question_latex: The incorrect statement is (Aug 2021)
options: A. $F_{2}$ is a stronger oxidising agent than $Cl_{2}$ in aqueous solution
B. on hydrolysis ClF forms HOCl and HF
C. $Cl_{2}$ is more reactive than ClF
D. $F_{2}$ is more reactive than ClF.
solution: Interhalogen compounds like ClF are generally more reactive than halogens (like $Cl_{2}$), except for $F_{2}$. This is because the X-X' bond is weaker than the X-X bond. [cite: 156, 157]

question: Which type of zeolite is used to convert alcohols directly into gasoline ?
question_latex: Which type of zeolite is used to convert alcohols directly into gasoline ?
solution: ZSM-5 type of zeolite is used to convert alcohols directly into gasoline. [cite: 161] Note: Document lists B as answer but solution text says ZSM-5 (Option C).

question: Aluminium chloride is a/an
question_latex: Aluminium chloride is a/an
solution: $AlCl_{3}$ is an electron-deficient compound and acts as a Lewis acid. [cite: 163]

question: The elements commonly used for making transistors are
question_latex: The elements commonly used for making transistors are
solution: Si and Ge are semiconductors and are used in making transistors.

question: Paramagnetic species are
question_latex: Paramagnetic species are
solution: NO, $NO_{2}$, and $O_{2}$ all contain unpaired electrons and are therefore paramagnetic.

question: Element of group 14 used in semiconductors are
question_latex: Element of group 14 used in semiconductors are
solution: Silicon (Si) and Germanium (Ge) from group 14 are widely used as semiconductors.

question: When Zn reacts with very dilute nitric acid it produces?
question_latex: When Zn reacts with very dilute nitric acid it produces?
solution: The reaction of Zinc with very dilute nitric acid is: $4Zn + 10HNO_{3} \rightarrow 4Zn(NO_{3})_{2} + NH_{4}NO_{3} + 3H_{2}O$.

question: Methanides are
question_latex: Methanides are
solution: Methanides like $Be_{2}C$ and $Al_{4}C_{3}$ react with water to produce methane ($CH_{4}$): $Be_{2}C + 4H_{2}O \rightarrow 2Be(OH)_{2} + CH_{4}$ and $Al_{4}C_{3} + 12H_{2}O \rightarrow 4Al(OH)_{3} + 3CH_{4}$.

question: Boron does not form $B^{3+}$ cation easily. It is due to
question_latex: Boron does not form $B^{3+}$ cation easily. It is due to
options: A. Energy required to form $B^{3+}$ ion is for more than that which would be compensated by lattice energies or hydration energies of such ion
solution: The sum of the first three ionization enthalpies of boron is very high, which prevents it from forming $B^{3+}$ ions easily; this energy is not compensated by lattice or hydration energies.

question: Which of the following reaction shows production of diborane on industrial scale?
question_latex: Which of the following reaction shows production of diborane on industrial scale?
solution: Diborane is produced on an industrial scale by the reaction of $BF_{3}$ with sodium hydride ($NaH$) at $450 K$.

question: $R_{3}SiCl$ on hydrolysis forms
question_latex: $R_{3}SiCl$ on hydrolysis forms
solution: Hydrolysis of $R_{3}SiCl$ initially gives $R_{3}SiOH$, which then undergoes condensation to form the dimer $R_{3}Si-O-SiR_{3}$.

question: Which of the following statements is true? (2006)
question_latex: Which of the following statements is true? (2006)
options: A. $HClO_{4}$ is a weaker acid than $HClO_{3}$.
B. $H_{3}PO_{3}$ is a stronger acid than $H_{2}SO_{3}$.
C. In aqueous medium HF is a stronger acid than HCl.
D. $HNO_{3}$ is a stronger acid than $HNO_{2}$.
solution: $HNO_{3}$ is a stronger acid than $HNO_{2}$ because higher oxidation states of the central atom increase acidity.

question: The basic structural unit of feldspar, zeolites, mica and asbestos is (April 2019)
question_latex: The basic structural unit of feldspar, zeolites, mica and asbestos is (April 2019)
solution: The basic structural unit of all silicates, including feldspar and zeolites, is the $SiO_{4}^{4-}$ tetrahedron.

question: The exhibition of highest co-ordination number depends on the availability of vacant orbitals in the central atom. Which of the following elements is not likely to act as central atom in $MF_{6}^{3-}$?
question_latex: The exhibition of highest co-ordination number depends on the availability of vacant orbitals in the central atom. Which of the following elements is not likely to act as central atom in $MF_{6}^{3-}$?
solution: Boron (B) belongs to the second period and lacks d-orbitals, so it cannot expand its coordination number beyond four.

question: Aqueous solution of which of the following boron compounds will be strongly basic in nature? (June 2022)
question_latex: Aqueous solution of which of the following boron compounds will be strongly basic in nature? (June 2022)
solution: $Na_{2}B_{4}O_{7}$ (borax) reacts with water to form NaOH (strong base) and $H_{3}BO_{3}$ (weak acid), resulting in a basic solution.

question: Choose the incorrect formula out of the four compounds for an element X given below. (Online 2015)
question_latex: Choose the incorrect formula out of the four compounds for an element X given below. (Online 2015)
solution: The formulas $X_{2}O_{3}$, $X_{2}(SO_{4})_{3}$, and $XPO_{4}$ suggest an oxidation state of +3. For this state, the correct chloride formula is $XCl_{3}$, not $X_{2}Cl_{3}$.

question: Which among the following statements is false regarding glass?
question_latex: Which among the following statements is false regarding glass?
options: B. It consists of silicates of sodium and alkali
C. HF causes marking on glass
D. All the halogen acids (HF, HCl, HBr and HI) are stored in glass bottles
solution: HF reacts with silicates in glass and therefore cannot be stored in glass bottles.

question: The electron gain enthalpy (in $kJ/mol$) of fluorine, chlorine, bromine and iodine respectively, are (Jan 2020)
question_latex: The electron gain enthalpy (in $kJ/mol$) of fluorine, chlorine, bromine and iodine respectively, are (Jan 2020)
solution: The correct sequence for electron gain enthalpy is $Cl > F > Br > I$.

question: The element that does not show catenation among the following p-block elements is
question_latex: The element that does not show catenation among the following p-block elements is
solution: The tendency for catenation decreases down group 14: $C >> Si > Ge \approx Sn > Pb$. Lead (Pb) shows no catenation.

question: A compound X, of boron reacts with $NH_{3}$ on heating to give another compound Y which is called inorganic benzene. The compound X can be prepared by treating $BF_{3}$ with lithium aluminium hydride. The compounds X and Y are represented by the formulas.
question_latex: A compound X, of boron reacts with $NH_{3}$ on heating to give another compound Y which is called inorganic benzene. The compound X can be prepared by treating $BF_{3}$ with lithium aluminium hydride. The compounds X and Y are represented by the formulas.
solution: Diborane ($B_{2}H_{6}$) reacts with ammonia to form borazine ($B_{3}N_{3}H_{6}$), which is known as inorganic benzene.

question: $Fe^{2+}$ reduces $NH_{2}OH$ to
question_latex: $Fe^{2+}$ reduces $NH_{2}OH$ to
solution: The reaction is $NH_{4}OH + Fe^{2+} \rightarrow Fe^{3+} + N_{3}H$.

question: Green house effect is due to
question_latex: Green house effect is due to
options: A. Disturbance of the earth's delicate thermal balance
B. Absorption of heat radiation by atmospheric gases particularly water vapours
solution: Greenhouse effect occurs when atmospheric gases like water vapor and $CO_{2}$ absorb heat radiation, trapping it in the atmosphere.

question: The bond dissociation energy of B-F in $BF_{3}$ is 646 kJ/mol whereas that of C-F in $CF_{4}$ is 515 kJ/mol. The correct reason for higher B-F bond dissociation energy as compared to that of C-F is (2009)
question_latex: The bond dissociation energy of B-F in $BF_{3}$ is $646\ kJ\ mol^{-1}$ whereas that of C-F in $CF_{4}$ is $515\ kJ\ mol^{-1}$. The correct reason for higher B-F bond dissociation energy as compared to that of C-F is (2009)
options: A. stronger bond between B and F in $BF_{3}$ as compared to that between C and F in $CF_{4}$
B. smaller size of B-atom as compared to that of C-atom
C. significant $p\pi - p\pi$ interaction between B and F in $BF_{3}$ whereas there is no possibility of such interaction between C and F in $CF_{4}$.
D. lower degree of $p\pi - p\pi$ interaction between B and F in $BF_{3}$ than that between C and F in $CF_{4}$
solution: In $BF_{3}$, the vacant 2p orbital on B overlaps with a filled 2p orbital on F ($p\pi - p\pi$ back bonding), increasing the bond strength. C in $CF_{4}$ has no vacant orbitals for such bonding.

question: Schweitzer's reagent is:
question_latex: Schweitzer's reagent is:
solution: Schweitzer's reagent is the tetraamminediaquacopper(II) hydroxide complex, often represented as $[Cu(NH_{3})_{4}]SO_{4}$ in salt form.

question: The lone pair present on N family hydrides more easily participates in bond formation in:
question_latex: The lone pair present on N family hydrides more easily participates in bond formation in:
solution: Basic character (lone pair donation) is maximum in $NH_{3}$ because the lone pair is concentrated on a smaller nitrogen atom.

question: The C-C bond length is maximum in (April 2019)
question_latex: The C-C bond length is maximum in (April 2019)
solution: In diamond, each carbon is $sp^{3}$ hybridized, leading to a C-C bond length of $1.54\ \text{\AA}$, which is longer than the bonds in $sp^{2}$ hybridized graphite or fullerenes.

question: Which is/are correct statements about $P_{4}O_{6}$ and $P_{4}O_{10}$?
question_latex: Which is/are correct statements about $P_{4}O_{6}$ and $P_{4}O_{10}$?
options: A. Both form oxyacids $H_{3}PO_{3}$ and $H_{3}PO_{4}$ respectively
B. In $P_{4}O_{6}$ each P is joined to four O and in $P_{4}O_{10}$ each P is joined to six O atoms
solution: $P_{4}O_{6} + 6H_{2}O \rightarrow 4H_{3}PO_{3}$ and $P_{4}O_{10} + 6H_{2}O \rightarrow 4H_{3}PO_{4}$. The coordination of P also changes as described.

question: Fermy's salt is:
question_latex: Fermy's salt is:
solution: $KHF_{2}$ (Potassium bifluoride) is known as Fremy's salt (noted as Fermy in text).

question: Aqueous solution of which of the following boron compounds will be strongly basic in nature? (June 2022)
question_latex: Aqueous solution of which of the following boron compounds will be strongly basic in nature? (June 2022)
solution: $Na_{2}B_{4}O_{7}$ on reaction with water gives $NaOH$ and $H_{3}BO_{3}$. $Na_{2}B_{4}O_{7} + 7H_{2}O \rightarrow 2H_{3}BO_{3} + 2Na[B(OH)_{4}]$. Aqueous solution of borax acts as a buffer with $pH = 9$.

question: Identify the incorrect statement. (Online 2016)
question_latex: Identify the incorrect statement. (Online 2016)
options: A. The S-S-S bond angles in the $S_{8}$ and $S_{6}$ rings are the same.
C. $S_{8}$ ring has a crown shape.
D. Rhombic and monoclinic sulphur have $S_{8}$ molecules.
solution: Sulphur have puckered $S_{8}$ rings with crown conformation ($107^{\circ}$) and Engel's sulphur contains $S_{6}$ rings arranged in a chair conformation ($102.2^{\circ}$). The bond angles are different.

question: The basic structural unit of feldspar, zeolites, mica and asbestos is(April 2019)
question_latex: The basic structural unit of feldspar, zeolites, mica and asbestos is(April 2019)
solution: The basic structural unit of all silicates is the $(SiO_{4})^{4-}$ tetrahedron.

question: Oxygen can be obtained from bleaching powder by:
question_latex: Oxygen can be obtained from bleaching powder by:
options: C. Heating with a cobalt salt
solution: $2CaOCl_{2} \xrightarrow{CoCl_{2}} 2CaCl_{2} + O_{2}$

question: Following are neutral oxides except
question_latex: Following are neutral oxides except
solution: $NO$, $N_{2}O$, and $CO$ are neutral oxides, while $NO_{2}$ is an acidic oxide.

question: The solution of sodium meta aluminate on boiling with ammonium chloride gives a white precipitate of
question_latex: The solution of sodium meta aluminate on boiling with ammonium chloride gives a white precipitate of
solution: $NH_{4}Cl + NaAlO_{2} + H_{2}O \rightarrow NaCl + Al(OH)_{3} + NH_{3}$. $Al(OH)_{3}$ is the white precipitate.

question: The element that does not form a monoxide is
question_latex: The element that does not form a monoxide is
solution: Silicon does not form a stable monoxide ($SiO$) under normal conditions; it primarily forms $SiO_{2}$.

question: Given below are the atomic numbers of some group 14 elements. The atomic number of the element with lowest melting point is: [Jan. 23, 2025 (II)]
question_latex: Given below are the atomic numbers of some group 14 elements. The atomic number of the element with lowest melting point is: [Jan. 23, 2025 (II)]
solution: The order of melting points in Group 14 is: $C > Si > Ge > Pb > Sn$. $Z=50$ is $Sn$ (Tin), which has the lowest melting point ($232^{\circ}C$ or $505\ K$) due to its distorted structure.

question: Which of the following oxides are acidic?
question_latex: Which of the following oxides are acidic?
solution: Transition metal oxides in high oxidation states are acidic. $Mn_{2}O_{7}$ reacts with water to give $HMnO_{4}$ and $CrO_{3}$ gives $H_{2}CrO_{4}$.

question: Catenation i.e., linking of similar atoms depends on size and electronic configuration of atoms. The tendency of catenation in Group 14 elements follows the order :
question_latex: Catenation i.e., linking of similar atoms depends on size and electronic configuration of atoms. The tendency of catenation in Group 14 elements follows the order :
solution: Catenation tendency decreases down the group as bond enthalpy decreases: $C >> Si > Ge \approx Sn$.

question: Ammonium dichromate is used in some fireworks. The green coloured powder blown is:
question_latex: Ammonium dichromate is used in some fireworks. The green coloured powder blown is:
solution: Thermal decomposition of ammonium dichromate: $(NH_{4})_{2}Cr_{2}O_{7} \xrightarrow{\Delta} N_{2} + Cr_{2}O_{3} + 4H_{2}O$. $Cr_{2}O_{3}$ is the green powder.

question: $(Me)_{2}SiCl_{2}$ on hydrolysis will produce
question_latex: $(Me)_{2}SiCl_{2}$ on hydrolysis will produce
solution: Hydrolysis of $(Me)_{2}SiCl_{2}$ yields $(Me)_{2}Si(OH)_{2}$, which undergoes intermolecular condensation to form linear or cyclic silicone polymers like $[-O-(Me)_{2}Si-O-]_{n}$. Note: The provided answer key in the text says B, but standard chemistry dictates polymerization (C).

question: The number of P-O-P bonds in $H_{4}P_{2}O_{7},$ $(HPO_{3})_{3}$ and $P_{4}O_{10}$ are respectively (April 2022)
question_latex: The number of P-O-P bonds in $H_{4}P_{2}O_{7},$ $(HPO_{3})_{3}$ and $P_{4}O_{10}$ are respectively (April 2022)
solution: In Pyrophosphoric acid ($H_{4}P_{2}O_{7}$), P-O-P bonds = 1. In Cyclotrimetaphosphoric acid ($(HPO_{3})_{3}$), P-O-P bonds = 3. In Phosphorus pentoxide ($P_{4}O_{10}$), P-O-P bonds = 6.

question: Fermy's salt is:
question_latex: Fermy's salt is:
solution: $KHF_{2}$ (Potassium bifluoride) is known as Fremy's (or Fermy's) salt.

question: The states of hybridization of boron and oxygen atoms in boric acid $(H_{3}BO_{3})$ are respectively (2004)
question_latex: The states of hybridization of boron and oxygen atoms in boric acid $(H_{3}BO_{3})$ are respectively (2004)
solution: In $H_{3}BO_{3}$, boron is bonded to three -OH groups and has no lone pair, so it is $sp^{2}$ hybridized. Oxygen has two lone pairs and two bonds, so it is $sp^{3}$ hybridized.

question: A substance X when heated with sulphuric acid liberates a gas which turns starch paper blue. The substance is:
question_latex: A substance X when heated with sulphuric acid liberates a gas which turns starch paper blue. The substance is:
solution: $2NaI + 2H_{2}SO_{4} \rightarrow Na_{2}SO_{4} + SO_{2} + H_{2}O + I_{2}$. The $I_{2}$ gas turns starch paper blue.

question: Which gas is essential constituent of almost all fuel gases ?
question_latex: Which gas is essential constituent of almost all fuel gases ?
solution: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a primary constituent of fuel gases like water gas ($CO+H_{2}$) and producer gas ($CO+N_{2}$).

question: Which group is called buffer group of the periodic table?
question_latex: Which group is called buffer group of the periodic table?
solution: Zero group (Noble gases) is called the buffer group because it lies between the highly electronegative halogens and highly electropositive alkali metals.

question: Which of the following is the pure form of carbon ?
question_latex: Which of the following is the pure form of carbon ?
options: D. All three forms are equally pure
solution: Fullerenes are considered the only pure form of carbon because they have a closed, smooth cage structure without dangling bonds.

question: NaOCl reacts with $NH_{3}$ to produce
question_latex: NaOCl reacts with $NH_{3}$ to produce
solution: $NH_{3} + NaOCl \rightarrow NaOH + NH_{2}Cl$ and $NH_{2}Cl + NH_{3} \rightarrow NH_{2}NH_{2} + HCl$. Hydrazine ($NH_{2}NH_{2}$) is formed.

question: Name of the structure of silicates in which three oxygen atoms of $[SiO_{4}]^{4-}$ are shared is
question_latex: Name of the structure of silicates in which three oxygen atoms of $[SiO_{4}]^{4-}$ are shared is
solution: In sheet silicates, three oxygen atoms per tetrahedron are shared with adjacent tetrahedra to form a two-dimensional layer.

question: $N_{2}O$ (laughing gas) finds use in the following except
question_latex: $N_{2}O$ (laughing gas) finds use in the following except
options: A. As a propellant for whipped ice-cream
solution: $N_{2}O$ is used as a propellant, anaesthetic, and oxidizer, but not as a primary fuel for rockets.

question: The electronic configuration of four different elements is given below. Identify the group 14 element among these
question_latex: The electronic configuration of four different elements is given below. Identify the group 14 element among these
solution: Group 14 elements have the valence shell configuration $ns^{2}np^{2}$. [Ne] $3s^{2}3p^{2}$ corresponds to Silicon.

question: Group-13 elements react with $O_{2}$ in amorphous form to form oxides of type $M_{2}O_{3}$. Which among the following is the most basic oxide? (April 2023)
question_latex: Group-13 elements react with $O_{2}$ in amorphous form to form oxides of type $M_{2}O_{3}$. Which among the following is the most basic oxide? (April 2023)
solution: In Group 13: $B_{2}O_{3}$ is acidic, $Al_{2}O_{3}$ and $Ga_{2}O_{3}$ are amphoteric, and $In_{2}O_{3}$ and $Tl_{2}O_{3}$ are basic. Basicity increases down the group.

question: The dipole moment of $NF_{3}$ is less than that of $NH_{3}$ because
question_latex: The dipole moment of $NF_{3}$ is less than that of $NH_{3}$ because
options: A. F is more reactive than H
C. The resultant of the individual bond polarities is less
D. The resultant of the individual bond polarities is opposed by the polarity of lone pair
solution: In $NH_{3}$, the lone pair moment and bond moments are in the same direction. In $NF_{3}$, the highly electronegative F atoms pull electron density away, so the bond moments oppose the lone pair moment.

question: In borax bead test which compound is formed?
question_latex: In borax bead test which compound is formed?
solution: $Na_{2}B_{4}O_{7} \cdot 10H_{2}O \xrightarrow{\Delta} Na_{2}B_{4}O_{7} \xrightarrow{\Delta} 2NaBO_{2} + B_{2}O_{3}$. The metal oxide reacts with $B_{2}O_{3}$ to form a colored meta-borate bead: $CuO + B_{2}O_{3} \rightarrow Cu(BO_{2})_{2}$. [cite: 777, 778]

question: Identify the incorrect statement for $PCl_{5}$ from the following. (June 2022)
question_latex: Identify the incorrect statement for $PCl_{5}$ from the following. (June 2022)
options: A. The geometry of $PCl_{5}$ is trigonal bipyramidal.
B. The three equatorial bonds of $PCl_{5}$ lie in a plane.
C. $PCl_{5}$ has two axial bonds stronger than three equatorial bonds.
D. In this molecule, orbitals of phosphorus are assumed to undergo $sp^{3}d$ hybridisation.
solution: In $PCl_{5}$, axial bonds are longer and weaker than equatorial bonds due to greater repulsion from the equatorial bond pairs. [cite: 784, 785]

question: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: Boron is extremely hard indicating its high lattice energy. Statement-II: Boron has highest melting and boiling point compared to its other group members. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (April 2023)
question_latex: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: Boron is extremely hard indicating its high lattice energy. Statement-II: Boron has highest melting and boiling point compared to its other group members. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: (April 2023)
options: A. Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct.
B. Statement-I is correct but Statement-II is incorrect.
C. Both Statement-I and Statement-II are incorrect.
D. Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct.
solution: Boron exists as a giant covalent polymeric structure with very high lattice energy, making it extremely hard with the highest melting and boiling points in group 13. [cite: 791, 792]

question: Bond angle of $109^{\circ} 28'$ is found in
question_latex: Bond angle of $109^{\circ} 28'$ is found in
solution: In $NH_{4}^{+}$, nitrogen is $sp^{3}$ hybridized with no lone pairs, resulting in a perfect tetrahedral geometry with a bond angle of $109^{\circ} 28'$. [cite: 795, 796]

question: White lead is
question_latex: White lead is
solution: White lead is a basic lead carbonate with the formula $2PbCO_{3} \cdot Pb(OH)_{2}$. [cite: 798, 799]

question: $H_{3}BO_{3}$ is
options: A. Monobasic and weak Lewis acid
B. Monobasic and weak Bronsted acid
C. Monobasic and strong Lewis acid
D. Tribasic and weak Bronsted acid
solution: Boric acid is not a protonic acid but acts as a weak Lewis acid by accepting electrons from a hydroxyl group of water: $B(OH)_{3} + 2H_{2}O \rightarrow [B(OH)_{4}]^{-} + H_{3}O^{+}$. [cite: 803, 804, 807, 809]

question: Percentage of lead in lead pencil is
question_latex: Percentage of lead in lead pencil is
solution: Lead pencils do not contain lead; they contain a mixture of graphite and clay. [cite: 813, 814]

question: Which among the following statements is false regarding glass?
question_latex: Which among the following statements is false regarding glass?
options: B. It consists of silicates of sodium and alkali
C. HF causes marking on glass
D. All the halogen acids (HF, HCl, HBr and HI) are stored in glass bottles
solution: HF (Hydrofluoric acid) cannot be stored in glass bottles because it reacts with the silicates in glass (etching). Other halogen acids like HCl, HBr, and HI do not react with glass. [cite: 818, 819]

question: Which reaction takes place during respiration?
question_latex: Which reaction takes place during respiration?
solution: Respiration is the biochemical process where glucose is oxidized to produce carbon dioxide, water, and energy. [cite: 822, 823]

question: A greenish yellow gas reacts with an alkali metal hydroxide to form a halate which can be used in fireworks and safety matches. The gas and halate respectively are:
question_latex: A greenish yellow gas reacts with an alkali metal hydroxide to form a halate which can be used in fireworks and safety matches. The gas and halate respectively are:
solution: Chlorine ($Cl_{2}$) is a greenish-yellow gas. It reacts with hot and concentrated KOH to form Potassium chlorate ($KClO_{3}$), used in fireworks. $3Cl_{2} + 6KOH \rightarrow KClO_{3} + 5KCl + 3H_{2}O$. [cite: 828, 830, 831, 832, 833, 834, 835]

question: The number of POP bonds in cyclic metaphosphoric acid is
question_latex: The number of POP bonds in cyclic metaphosphoric acid is
solution: Cyclotrimetaphosphoric acid $(HPO_{3})_{3}$ contains a six-membered ring with 3 P-O-P bonds. [cite: 838, 839, 843]

question: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: In group 13, the stability of +1 oxidation state increases down the group. Statement-II: The atomic size of gallium is greater than that of aluminium. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: [05 April, 2024 (Shift-I)]
question_latex: Given below are two statements: Statement-I: In group 13, the stability of +1 oxidation state increases down the group. Statement-II: The atomic size of gallium is greater than that of aluminium. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below: [05 April, 2024 (Shift-I)]
options: A. Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct
B. Both Statement-I and Statement-II are incorrect
C. Statement-I is correct but Statement-II is incorrect
D. Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct
solution: Statement-I is correct due to the inert pair effect. Statement-II is incorrect because gallium is slightly smaller than aluminium due to poor shielding by 3d electrons. [cite: 847, 848, 850]

question: Which of the following statements are true?
question_latex: Which of the following statements are true?
options: A. Cold and very dilute $HNO_{3}$ forms $NH_{4}NO_{3}$ with Zn or Sn
C. Cold and more concentrated $HNO_{3}$ forms $NO_{2}$ with Cu
D. All the above are correct
solution: Nitric acid exhibits different reactions based on concentration and temperature with metals like Zn, Sn, and Cu. All given statements correctly describe these specific redox behaviors. [cite: 855]

question: The silver halide, which is least soluble in $NH_{4}OH,$ is:
question_latex: The silver halide, which is least soluble in $NH_{4}OH,$ is:
solution: Silver iodide ($AgI$) is insoluble in ammonium hydroxide due to its high covalent character. [cite: 859, 860, 861]

question: Bromine is obtained on a commercial scale from:
question_latex: Bromine is obtained on a commercial scale from:
solution: Carnallite ($KCl \cdot MgCl_{2} \cdot 6H_{2}O$) contains trace amounts of bromide salts, making it a source for commercial bromine extraction. [cite: 863, 864]

question: Which molecule does not possess distorted geometry?
question_latex: Which molecule does not possess distorted geometry?
solution: In $IF_{7}$, there are no lone pairs on the central Iodine atom (7 bond pairs), resulting in a perfect pentagonal bipyramidal geometry. [cite: 867, 868]

question: Antichlor is a compound:
question_latex: Antichlor is a compound:
options: B. Which removes $Cl_{2}$ from a material
C. Which liberates $Cl_{2}$ from bleaching powder
D. Which acts as a catalyst in the manufacture of $Cl_{2}$
solution: Antichlors are substances used to remove excess chlorine from materials after bleaching to prevent damage to fibers. [cite: 871, 872]

question: Common name of phosgene is
question_latex: Common name of phosgene is
solution: Phosgene ($COCl_{2}$) is chemically known as carbonyl chloride. [cite: 875]

question: Glass is a
question_latex: Glass is a
solution: Glass is an amorphous solid that behaves like a liquid of extremely high viscosity, often called a supercooled liquid. [cite: 878, 879]

question: Which one of the following statements regarding helium is incorrect?
question_latex: Which one of the following statements regarding helium is incorrect?
options: A. It is used to produce and sustain powerful super conducting magnets
B. It is used in gas-cooled nuclear reactors
C. It is used to fill gas balloons instead of hydrogen because it is lighter and non-inflammable
D. It is used as a cryogenic agent for carrying out experiments at low temperature
solution: Statement C is incorrect because Helium is actually twice as heavy as Hydrogen ($H_{2}$ molecular weight 2 vs He atomic weight 4). It is used because it is non-inflammable. [cite: 881, 882]

question: $p\pi - p\pi$ multiple bonds occur between
question_latex: $p\pi - p\pi$ multiple bonds occur between
solution: $p\pi - p\pi$ bonding is common in second-period elements. Examples include $C=C$, $C=O$, and $C\equiv N$. [cite: 886, 887, 888]

question: The bonds present in $N_{2}O_{5}$ are:
question_latex: The bonds present in $N_{2}O_{5}$ are:
solution: $N_{2}O_{5}$ contains covalent bonds and coordinate covalent bonds (dative bonds) between Nitrogen and Oxygen. [cite: 892]

question: Structure of $XeF_{5}^{+}$ ion is
question_latex: Structure of $XeF_{5}^{+}$ ion is
solution: In $XeF_{5}^{+}$, Xenon has 5 bond pairs and 1 lone pair ($sp^{3}d^{2}$ hybridization). The geometry is square pyramidal. [cite: 895, 897, 898, 899, 900, 901]

question: Heating an aqueous solution of aluminum chloride to dryness will give (2005)
question_latex: Heating an aqueous solution of aluminum chloride to dryness will give (2005)
solution: Heating $AlCl_{3} \cdot 6H_{2}O$ results in hydrolysis due to the high charge density of $Al^{3+}$, eventually yielding $Al_{2}O_{3}$ and HCl gas rather than anhydrous $AlCl_{3}$. [cite: 904, 905, 906]

question: $P_{2}O_{5}$ is used extensively as a:
question_latex: $P_{2}O_{5}$ is used extensively as a:
solution: Phosphorus pentoxide ($P_{2}O_{5}$ or $P_{4}O_{10}$) is a powerful dehydrating agent due to its high affinity for water. [cite: 913, 914]
